intro: Raphiacme, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that develop into elongated, slender seed heads. It is often found in disturbed soils and open areas, thriving in temperate climates. Raphiacme is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
